definition: 100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

sentences.english: The stuff in the sugar bowl. We’re not talking about complex carbohydrates, which are merely long strings of sugars.
sentences.chinese: 我们不讨论碳水化合物，那是一长串糖的合成物。

sentences.english: Corticosteroids and their synthetic analogs are used to treat rheumatism and other inflammatory ailments.
sentences.chinese: 皮质类固醇及其合成物可用来治疗风湿病和其它炎症。

sentences.english: These are the same type of compounds people have been using for centuries.
sentences.chinese: 几百年来人们用的是同一类合成物。

sentences.english: Appetites and aversions, moreover, are not simple qualities but composites.
sentences.chinese: 欲望和厌恶并非简单的特质，而是种合成物。

sentences.english: Conlon says the new compounds show promise in fighting 2 major pathogens.
sentences.chinese: 肯伦说，新合成物有希望对抗两种主要的病原体。

sentences.english: The conductivities of the composites increase as the number of ordered carbon layers increases.
sentences.chinese: 合成物增加的导电率当做命令的碳层的数字增加。

sentences.english: The image of Ganesha is a composite one.
sentences.chinese: 甘尼萨的肖像是一个合成物。

definition: a derivative (complex product derived from simpler source material)
